intro: Bartramia pulchella, commonly known as the pretty moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, dark green to reddish-brown shoots and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices. The plant forms dense, cushion-like mats and has a distinctive, slender leaf structure with a long, tapering apex. It is widely distributed across North America and is particularly common in the eastern United States. Bartramia pulchella plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
